alert.note: Alert for Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued June 13 at 7:29PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected for elevations above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of mostly 3 to 6 inches, but over 12 inches are possible above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Southern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult into the mountains. Strong winds could cause damage to snow-loaded trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Those recreating in the backcountry should be prepared for cold and raw conditions, and may even consider moving to a lower elevation.
info.instruction: Be prepared for cold and wet conditions if in the wilderness areas.
